title: Increase number of bugs by sending duplicate of your own valid report

profile.name: HackerOne
profile.about: Vulnerability disclosure should be safe, transparent, and rewarding.

vulnerability_information:
HI,

This report is a basically a design issue and something similar to report where someone can gain reputations by sending dup. Not very high severity bug and i know you all can always roll back the changes. also it lies more on team rather than a system. but it happened before with me (although bugs were different , team marked it dup for some reason) .so thought of reporting it

The difference here is, you don't increase your reputation but you can increase your number of bugs!

Steps
1. The obvious pre requisite here is, you have to send valid report to any team
2. Wait for it to get triaged. once it is triaged, it is almost certain that it will be resolved!
3.Send the same report again with little modification, may be by changing the title and description
4. Now most teams will mark this as duplicate of your own report!
5. But when the original report gets resolved, your reputation remains the same but number of bugs increases by 2(one for original and one for dup).

if you keep on submitting such bugs multiple times, you can boost your number of bugs which may create false impression (which will look good to others as profiles are public)

The obvious resolution would be , not to count dup report if its dup of your own report!

Regards
Ashish
vulnerability_information_html:
HI,

This report is a basically a design issue and something similar to report where someone can gain reputations by sending dup. Not very high severity bug and i know you all can always roll back the changes. also it lies more on team rather than a system. but it happened before with me (although bugs were different , team marked it dup for some reason) .so thought of reporting it

The difference here is, you don't increase your reputation but you can increase your number of bugs!

Steps

  1. The obvious pre requisite here is, you have to send valid report to any team
  2. Wait for it to get triaged. once it is triaged, it is almost certain that it will be resolved! 3.Send the same report again with little modification, may be by changing the title and description
  3. Now most teams will mark this as duplicate of your own report!
  4. But when the original report gets resolved, your reputation remains the same but number of bugs increases by 2(one for original and one for dup).

if you keep on submitting such bugs multiple times, you can boost your number of bugs which may create false impression (which will look good to others as profiles are public)

The obvious resolution would be , not to count dup report if its dup of your own report!

Regards
Ashish

activities.message:
Hey @ashish_goanhacker,

So as far as I understand your comment, you have found that submitting duplicates of your own reports doesn't affect your reputation, which is as intended. The number of bugs increasing is, in fact, useful information to examiner's of a user's profile as they can deduce from the total reputation and the number of bugs that the user isn't getting as much reputation per bug as other researchers (if that user has been submitting many duplicates of their own reports). Because of this, we don't consider this to be a vulnerability.

Thanks! And happy hacking!


Evan
activities.markdown_message:

The number of bugs increasing is, in fact, useful information to examiner's of a user's profile as they can deduce from the total reputation and the number of bugs that the user isn't getting as much reputation per bug as other researchers (if that user has been submitting many duplicates of their own reports). Because of this, we don't consider this to be a vulnerability.

Thanks! And happy hacking!

Evan

activities.message:
what i meant was, the number of bugs increases when you submit the duplicate of your own report and gets resolved. suppose i have 10 bugs shown in profile. if i submit 4 duplicates of my own valid report. so when my original bug gets resolved, the bug count will go to 15 instead of 11. so all duplicate report of my own report are counted as bugs and added to profile.

Note that, the increasing of bugs with this behaviour also improves signal reputation!

activities.message: Any update on this? Could you look at other angle of improving signal point atleast?
activities.markdown_message: Any update on this? Could you look at other angle of improving signal point atleast?

activities.message:
Hey @ashish_goanhacker 

Thanks for the followup! Although we're not too concerned about the report count, you raise a good point about the alterations someone can make to their signal score. As such, I'm reopening this and we'll take another look.

Thanks!


Evan

Hey @ashish_goanhacker

Thanks!

Evan

Thanks for your patience!

activities.message:
I found this bug by closely monitoring the signal points from the bugs which i submitted. I cant submit dup report again to any team and confirm the fix for now. 

My signal points have been changed , so thats the only way i think i can confirm the fix at the moment!

activities.message: Thanks for the bounty. Just want to ask whether all duplicate(including duplicate of NA) reports are excluded from signal calculation?
activities.markdown_message: Thanks for the bounty. Just want to ask whether all duplicate(including duplicate of NA) reports are excluded from signal calculation?

activities.message: That's correct. We internally debated whether partial-inclusion of duplicates (such as dup-NA) might be the way forward, but ultimately decided that a complete exclusion of duplicates would be most clear and consistent.
activities.markdown_message: That's correct. We internally debated whether partial-inclusion of duplicates (such as dup-NA) might be the way forward, but ultimately decided that a complete exclusion of duplicates would be most clear and consistent.
